bropals.lib.simplegame.io

Class BinaryFileStorage<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • bropals.lib.simplegame.io.BinaryFileStorage<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of object that is being read and written to a binary file.

    public abstract class BinaryFileStorage<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Reads and writes to files via a binary stream.

    This is for saving and loading game data to a file via binary storage, but is different than a DataInputStream and DataOutputStream because one should extend and override the readFile() and writeFile() methods to better encapsulate what is being read and written.

      • readFile

        public abstract T readFile(java.io.File file)
        Reads a binary file and interprets it as an object.
        Parameters:
        file - the file that is being read.
        Returns:
        the object created from the data stored in the file.

      • writeFile

        public abstract void writeFile(T object,
             java.io.File file)
        Writes the object to the given binary file. Whether or not this function overwrites the file is dependent on the implementation of it.
        Parameters:
        object - the object to write.
        file - the binary file to write it to.

        protected void openInput(java.io.File file)

      • openOutput

        protected void openOutput(java.io.File file,
              boolean append)
        Opens binary output with the specified file so that this object can use its write functions.
        Parameters:
        file - the file to open the output to.
        append - whether or not the file should be appended to.

      • readString

        public java.lang.String readString()
        Reads the next boolean from the binary stream. The format for strings in a binary stream that this class uses is to first read a short that is the number of bytes taken up by the string, then read that many bytes, grouping them up to a string.
        Returns:
        the read boolean.

      • writeString

        public void writeString(java.lang.String str)
        Writes the given String to the end of the binary output. This is done by first writing a short that is how many bytes the String takes up, then by writing the byte data that is the String.
        Parameters:
        str - the String to write.
